w:HTMLPanel.title: PWT - Tutorial Part 1 - Init a PWT Project with Gradle

w:Header.w:Heading: Part 1 - Init a PWT Project with Gradle

w:HTMLPanel.p: In this tutorial, we will init a PWT project named putnami-pwt-tutorial from scratch.

w:Alert.p: In this tutorial, we use Gradle to build the project. If you use Maven, you should see the Maven version here

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Gradle and GWT notice
w:HTMLPanel.p: Gradle does not support any official GWT plugin yet. However, there is a very nice one hosted on Github : Steffen Sch√§ffer's gwt-gradle-plugin. Unfortunately, today there is a little typo in the source code making impossible to define different modules between production tasks (like compile) and dev tasks (like GWT's SuperDevMode).

To work, the GWT's SuperDevMode needs some specific configuration in the module gwt.xml file (like a specific linker, etc...). So it is necessary to have the ability to define different modules between dev and production.
Therefore we've forked it and fixed it. We've submited the issue and we wait for the next release. Waiting we host a patch on our repository : *0.4-PWT_patched*.
On this tutorial, we only explains the bases of the plugin. You can refer to the official doc to go furher.
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 1 : Create the project folder
w:HTMLPanel.p: Just create the project root folder named "putnami-pwt-tutorial".
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 2 : Create the build script
w:HTMLPanel.p: In the project folder, create the gradle build file (build.gradle).

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 4 : Create an Entry point and a Module Xml file
w:HTMLPanel.p: Now, as a GWT application, we need to create a Module xml file and an entry point.

ol.li:
In the build script configuration, we used the "fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.Tutorial" module so we juste have to create it by creating the file fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/Tutorial.gwt.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <module rename-to="Tutorial"> <!-- PWT Module to extends in order to use PWT widgets--> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.core.widget.Widget"/>
<entry-point class="fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.client.TutorialApp"/>
<!-- This linker will be the default one in later version of GWT --> <add-linker name="xsiframe" /> </module>

We also create a GWT module file for the dev tasks : fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/TutorialDev.gwt.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <module rename-to="Tutorial"> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.Tutorial" />
<!-- We collapse all properties --> <collapse-property name="user.agent" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="locale" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="canvasElementSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="touchEventSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="dragEventSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="audioElementSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="videoElementSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="storageSupport" values="*" />
<set-configuration-property name="devModeRedirectEnabled" value="true" /> </module>
Note :
In the dev module, we do not use the collapse-all-properties tag because it induce a bug in source mapping in browsers.
